I'm not sure...
On the "No we're safe side"
Our government still has cash to bail out depositors as we haven't had to re-cap our banks (yet). Gillard is desperate for re-election so wouldn't do it and if she wins knows they're looking for an excuse to ditch her. Abbott if he is elected won't want to do it as he's only just got power Aussies haven't been beaten down like most of Europe through austerity so we'd not be happy and the government must expect blow-back.
On the "Yes, they'll take it side"
Our banks are ridiculously large, especially when compared to European banks meaning 'saving' them will be a large undertaking Our banks own masses of over-valued properties and need at least 40% of their funding from overseas sources.
If it's a 'small' crisis, I think they'd bail everyone out.
For a larger crisis, I think our government would probably now do a half/half approach (which I agree with) i.e. equity and bond investors take a hit, depositors (regardless of size of account) are all safe.
But this is easy for me to say as I don't have much to keep in the bank! Your money, your choice.
Australian banks, like the US banks, have the ability to print money, therefore they wont need to do it, they will just print (and confiscate wealth via inflation)
